Señora Nora indicates that she has worked with Pro Mujer for a number of cycles and that she joined the institution through the invitation of a loan officer. Now she has a business where she sells rugs, in which she has been working for years, having learned the business from her parents.  

The loan that she will take out now will be used to increase her capital (buy rugs), which she will acquire from El Alto and later sell at her sales stall. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health center.

Señora Francisca was not present in the photograph for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy rugs

loans.name: Airtime Group

texts.en: Clever is a 34 year old married man from Masvingo, Zimbabwe. He has two children. One child is still going to school. He is into the business of selling cellphone airtime credit cards. Clever has been in the business for two years. He has requested a loan of $150.00 to buy more stock. With the income from the loan he will be able to provide for his family. The challenge he faces in the business is that the product margin is very small therefore he has to sell large volumes of airtime for better returns. His vision for the next 5 years is to open a wholesale business selling airtime cards such that he will be in a position to supply airtime for both network providers in the country.

loans.use: to buy airtime card to sell in his cellphone business.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala es madre de familia de 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en una zona rural donde se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería exclusivamente, la casa en la que viven es propia y esta ubicada en el caserío de nombre “Sinchi Roca” el cual pertenece al distrito de Tambogrande y el mismo a la provincia de Piura. Por ser un pequeño caserío en vía de desarrollo por ahora solo cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica.

Cliente cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida y chicha de jora para lo que ha acondicionado un lugar en su propio domicilio para la atención de sus clientes atendiendo solo 4 días a la semana (viernes, sábados, domingos, lunes) los mismos que son de mas afluencia de su publico a quien atiende con mucho respeto y cuidado. 
Al negocio se dedica junto a su esposa quien apoya desde las primeras horas del día hasta terminar con la venta estimada.

Se ha propuesto en hacer mas grande su negocio para poder obtener mayores utilidades para lo que esta dispuesto en invertir en la compra de mobiliario (mesas, sillas) para poder recibir mas clientes ya que considera que lo que tiene por ahora limita a sus ventas diarias. Para lograr ese objetivo esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles.
Pues se han ganado el cariño de sus clientes y de sus vecinos debido a que son una familia muy unida y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a mother, 40, who lives with her husband and son in a rural area where everyone works in farming and cattle ranching. They own their home in a village called Sinchi Roca which is in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura. Because it's a small village on the road to development, right now the only utility they have is electricity.

She has a business selling food and chicha de jora [a corn drink] which she has set up in her own house where she serves her customers 4 days a week (Friday-Monday). She attends her customers with an abundance of respect and care.

She works with the support of her husband from the early hours of the day until she finishes her estimated sales.

She has proposed increasing the size of her business so that she can make more money. For that reason she wants to invest in the purchase of furniture (tables and chairs) so that she can receive more customers because right now she feels like that is limiting her daily sales. In order to achieve this objective she is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles.

She has won the affection of her customers and neighbors due to the fact that they are a very united and hardworking family.

loans.use: to buy furniture (chairs and tables).

loans.name: Raad

texts.en:
Raad is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married and has four children.

Since 1996 Raad has owned a garage, repairing and fixing cars. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in his neighborhood.

Raad is requesting a 3000 USD loan from CHF in order to renovate his garage, make more shelves and buy a neon sign for his shop. He is aiming to make more in profits so as to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his garage, make more shelves and buy a neon sign for his shop.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 47 years old, married, and has 10 children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  She has been farming rice for 10 years.  

Wilma is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fertilzers and farm supplies

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 27 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school. She lives in Yambio and for the past two years has run a food stall. Grace heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this will be her forth BRAC loan.

Grace is requesting a 2,000 SDG loan from BRAC to purchase onions and beans. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (summer clothing).

loans.name: Moyo Murefu Group

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Getrude from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe and a member of the Moyo Murefu Group. She is married with three children, one of whom is attending school.

For the past two years Getrude has raised chickens to sell. She says the main challenge she faces is the short supply of day-old chicks.

Getrude and her group members have requested a loan of $1600 from MFK. With her $400 portion of this loan she will buy chicken feed and laying hens. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to enhance her family’s welfare.

In the future Getrude plans to be a supplier of both eggs and chicken meat to various supermarkets in the country.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and laying hens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional pieces of construction equipment to sell or lease.

loans.name: Igor

texts.ru:
Игорь – из Гладковки. Он – фермер. На 20 сотках земли выращивает в теплицах 4 000 кустов огурцов и 2 тонны раннего картофеля за сезон. Сельским хозяйством занимается уже 4 года. В хозяйство вложил немалые деньги – около 70 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет немногим больше 3 000 гривен. 

Игорю необходимы дополнительные заемные средства в размере 7 000 гривен для того, чтобы купить полиэтиленовую пленку на сумму в 4 500 гривен и перетянуть ее в теплицах для нового сезона, а также хорошие семена для выращивания рассады на оставшиеся 2 500 гривен. Бизнес позволяет Игорю генерировать средства, чтобы содержать семью и это крайне немаловажно в регионе, где зачастую совсем мало возможностей для трудоустройства. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Igor is a farmer in Gladkovka. On one-fifth of a hectare of land, each season he grows 4,000 cucumber plants in greenhouses, as well as 2 tons of early potatoes. Igor has been farming for four years and has invested a significant sum in his farm - around 70,000 hryvnias. His net income amounts to slightly  over 3,000 hryvnias. 

Igor needs to borrow additional funds totalling 7,000 hryvnias to purchase plastic film for 4,500 hryvnias and re-cover his greenhouses for the new season. The remaining 2,500 hryvnias will be spent on quality seeds from which he will grow sprouts. His business allows Igor to generate enough income to support his family, and this is very important in a region where employment opportunities are often sparse.

loans.use: to buy new plastic film for his greenhouses, and seeds for growing sprouts

loans.name: Toribia

texts.es: La Sra. Toribia tiene 52 años no esta casada pero convive con su pareja con el cual tienen hijos que son 10, 8 y 14 que se encuentra en edad escolar, la Sra. Toribia se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra maíz y papa, su parcela  que se encuentran ubicada en Monte Grande, este es el primer préstamo que tiene con la institución, La Sra. Toribia usara este préstamo para para los gastos que implica la  siembra de papa y la cosecha de maíz La Sra. Toribia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza . Va a utilizar los beneficios par mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, la Sra. Toribia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Toribia is 52 years old, she isn’t married but lives with her partner, they have 10, 8, 14 year old children who are in school. Mrs. Toribia works in agriculture, she grows corn and potatoes, and her land is located in Monte Grande. This is her first loan with the institution and it will be used to for the expenses incurred in growing potatoes and her corn crops. Mrs. Toribia has some challenges in her business but her goal is to get out of poverty, she will use the benefits from the investment to improve her quality of life as well as that of her family. Mrs. Toribia is happy and grateful with the institution for the support given to her.

loans.use: improve her potato and corn harvest.

loans.name: Aniuwe

texts.en:
Aniuwe lives in Yambio. She sells clothes and has been in business for three year. She is 25 years old, married, and has one child one who is still in school. 

Aniuwe heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2500 in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Sari Indah Group

texts.en:
The Sari Indah received their loan with the same amount as the last time and the members also received the same amount.

Ni Ayu will use this loan to buy five superior piglets. She decided to choose the superior quality piglets because they bring in a high price when  she sells them later and it's easier to find a big buyer. She hope the business can run smoothly and give her enough profit to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase five superior piglets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruits, such as oranges and tangerines, for resale.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Sreymom, 26, is single and resides with her sister in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her sister are teachers in private school. They earn about USD 7 per day. Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Sreymom is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide a better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Carla Fiorella

texts.es:
Carla es una joven de 22 años que convive junto a su pareja y ambos tienen un pequeño de 2 años de edad al cual adora mucho y por el cual ella daría la vida con verlos feliz y que no pase penurias; ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, 	ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por su agricultura y sus por la generosidad de sus pobladores, la comida peruana es muy deliciosa por ello uno de los platos que le gusta mucho a Carla son los riquísimos Tallarines Rojos; en su tiempo libre a Carla le gusta escuchar música , porque es una manera de relajarse, debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres solo pudo estudiar educación primaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar secretariado.

Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa al cual le dedica alrededor de 5 horas diarias, ella ofrece sus productos visitando las casa de sus clientes, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de cálida y que están de moda.

Carla agradece a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada ella podrá comprar mas mercadería en especial para la temporada escolar, lo que le permitirá poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y tener mas ingresos, para así seguir luchando y poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener una Tienda propia y darle una buena calidad de vida a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Carla, 22, is a young woman who lives with her parents and has a 2-year-old son who she adores and for whom she would give her life to see him happy and without difficulties. She lives in the city of Ica, known for its warm climate year round and also for agriculture, and the generosity of its people. Peruvian food is delicious and one of Carla's favorite dishes is Tallarines Rojos. In her free time Carla likes to listen to music, because it's a way for her to relax. Given her parents' limited financial resources, she was only able to complete elementary school, but she would have liked to go to high school.

With hard work and savings she was able to start a business selling clothing, where she works about 5 hours a day. She goes to her customers homes to make sales. She thinks its going well because she offers quality, fashionable products.

Carla is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she will be able to buy more merchandise in time for the school season. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and make more income so that she can keep fighting to reach her dream: having her own store and giving her son a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (for the school season).

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to improve her carpentry business. With the loan, she wants to purchase timber, nails and clamps. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of vegetables in the future. She says, "Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving me an opportunity to improve my business."

loans.use: To purchase timber, nails and clamps.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La Sra. Matilde tiene 64 años de edad, está soltera, tiene 2 hijos ya todos casados que viven en la Argentina.
Tiene un comedor bien equipado, es su local propio, viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo donde tienen su local. Se inicio como rentista, y después abrió su comedor, que hasta hoy le va muy bien, con clientela ya bien formada por su antigüedad en el rubro. Ya que conoce muy bien el mercado al que se dedica.
Solicita el crédito para las compras de carne, condimento, panificados, y demás insumos  con los cuales prepara los alimentos que vende. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda recibida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Matilde is 64 years old, single and has 2 children who are married and live in Argentina.

She has a well equipped dining space in her own stall. She lives in the city of Coronel Oviedo where she has her business. She began her work by renting the dining space and later on opened her own. At present, she has been doing very well and has an established customer base due to the time she has spent working in her field since she knows her work very well.

Mrs. Matilde needs the loan to buy meat, spices, bread, and other materials that will be used to make the food that she sells. She is grateful to the foundation and Kiva for the help received.

loans.use: buy meat, spices, bread, and other materials.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Yambio where she sells from a food stall. She has been in business for two years. She is 27 year old, married, and has one child whose is not in school. 

Grace heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Santa Librada” empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya mediante la promoción hecha a una de las miembros, quien fue miembro de un comité de la zona que ya no volvió a renovar, la misma ha decidido buscar para sus socias y  luego de una constante comunicación y visita de la  asesora se logró formar un grupo integrado por 12 mujeres de la misma zona. Las señoras son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo y familiarmente. Mencionaron que se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en equipo, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres.
Victoriana es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de queso y leche, y comenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que siempre tiene muy buenos productos. Gracias a su trabajo ha podido salir adelante y de esa forma ayudar a su familia con lo que lo de su negocio. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche y queso para tener en stock y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia. Agradecen todas ellas por la oportunidad que les da fundación paraguaya y kiva.
texts.en:
The women's committee "Santa Librada" started working with the Fundación Paraguaya through the promotion of one of its members who had been part of another committee in the area that didn't get renewed. She decided to look for partners and after a lot of communication and a visit from the adviser she was able to form a group of 12 women from her zone. The women are very united and responsible and are very willing to work hard to get ahead, both within the group and with regards to their families. They mentioned that they are very happy working in a team, with a lot of effort and care, under the program Comite de Mujeres.

Victoriana is one of the members of the group. She sells cheese and milk and says she has a very good clientele because she always has good products. Thanks to her work she has made progress and been able to help her family. Her goal is to be able to keep growing her business and therefore keep helping her family.

She asked for a loan to buy milk and cheese to have in stock. She thanks everyone for the opportunity that Kiva and the Fundacion Paraguaya have given her.

loans.use: to buy milk and cheese.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is widow and a potter in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now and earns additional income by selling food. She works hard to support her family.

Loreta has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials to make her pottery. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make her pottery.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 55 years old, married and has five children. She is a hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past ten years Magdalena has run a restaurant in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy the ingredients needed in her restaurant.

Magdalena would like to save enough money to expand her restaurant sometime in the future.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed in her restaurant.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Angel es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, tiene 52 años de edad, estuvo casada por más de 25 años, del matrimonio nació una hija; Carolina de 28 años. por cosas de la vida se separó y con mucho sacrificio se repuso,  acompañado de su hija montaron un copetín en su domicilio.
El Sr. Angel comenzó su pequeño negocio hace cinco años, monto un copetín con su única hija quienes quedaron choqueados por la experiencia que les toco vivir, comenta que que en principio fue muy difícil, pero con el apoyo de sus vecinos y familiares lograron salir adelante, ahora cuentan con clientela formada y sus productos son bien caseros y del agrado de todos ellos. El mayor sueño de don Angel es aumentar su negocio ofreciendo  un lindo comedor.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de Carne, huevo, discos, aceite, gaseosas, y demás insumos que utilizará en su copetín. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Sr. Angel lives in the city of Coronel Oviedo. He is 52 and was married for more than 25 years. A daughter was born to the marriage, Carolina, who is 28.  Due to things that happen in life, he became separated but, with a lot of sacrifice, he did recover. Accompanied by his daughter, he started a small restaurant in his house.

Angel started his small business five years ago. As noted, he did so with his only daughter. Both of them were shattered by the experience they had been through. He notes that at first, it was very difficult, however with the support of neighbors and relatives they were able to move forward. Now they have an established clientele and their home-made products are well liked  by all. Angel’s biggest dream is to increase his business by offering a nice dining room. 

He is requesting a loan to buy meat, eggs, turnover dough, cooking oil, soft drinks and other supplies that will be used in his restaurant.  He is grateful to the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, turnover dough, cooking oil, soft drinks and other supplies.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin tiene 34 años no esta casado pero tiene su pareja tiene tres hijos que son de 3, 6, 8 años de edad, se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de papa y de maíz, su parcela se encuentran en Paso el Chivo, este es el primer préstamo que saco con  la institución, El sr. Edwin   va a usar este préstamo  para los gastos que implica la siembra de papa y cosecha de maíz,   y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su siembra, tener mas ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida. El Sr. Edwin es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad con la que el Sr. Edwin mantiene a su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Edwin is 34 years old, he is not married but he and his partner have three children of 3, 6 and 8 years of age. He works in agriculture by growing potatoes and corn, his field is located in Paso el Chivo. This is his first loan with the institution and will use the money to pay for the expenses garnered by his potato and corn harvest. Mr. Edwin will improve his crops and have more income that will lead to a better quality of life. Mr. Edwin is a very hardworking person and is very happy and grateful with the institution for the support since this is the only source of income for Mr. Edwin to take care of his family.

loans.use: improve his potato and corn crops.

loans.name: Agbékè Séraphine

texts.fr: Agée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants, Séraphine a sa baraque dans le plus grand marché de la ville  où elle vend ses produits dont les sachets plastiques et les produits de soins corporels. Elle a sollicité l'aide de Finadev pour fournir plus d'articles à ses clients fidèles et potentiels.
texts.en: At the age of 41, Séraphine is a married mother of three. She has a stall at the large market in the city where she sells her products, such as plastic bags and personal care products. Séraphine has requested aid from Finadev to furnish more items for her loyal and prospective customers.

loans.use: to buy a sack of plastic bags, a box of eau de cologne, a box of hair straightener, a box of toothpaste, and a box of body powder.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan, Liberia. She is married and has four children ages ten to 24 who go to school and live at home.

For the past 22 years Marie has been selling coconuts in the local market. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 LRD from BRAC Liberia to purchase a greater number of coconuts to sell.

Marie’s plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase a greater number of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Danai Group

texts.en: This is 51 year old Mebow from Harare. She is single with two children. Mebow runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 6 years. She says the main challenges faced are proper trading spaces as most of them have no proper shelter. Mebow has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy more clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family. In the future Mebow plans to own a bigger clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Santosa

texts.es:
Santosa tiene 32 años, vive en la ciudad de pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por hermosas playas, por su clima cálido y por uno de los atractivos turísticos más hermosos de nuestro país que son las islas ballestas y el candelabro, Santosa ama la comida peruana y uno de los platillos que mas le gusta es el riquísimo “Ají de gallina”, es madre y tiene 2 hijos cuyas edades comprende 4 y 14 años, a los cuales quiere muchisimo y son su razon de vivir, por razones económicas ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar gastronomía porque le gusta mucho Cocinar.

Gracias a la buena sazón que tiene para la preparación de platillos ella inicio su negocio de venta de uno de los platos bandera del Perú que es el riquísimo “Ceviche”, desde hace 11 meses Santosa se levanta muy temprano para ir en busca de los insumos para la preparación de este platillo, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene una buena sazón y además porque trata a los clientes de manera amable.

Santosa agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrán una congeladora y un mostrador para la venta de sus platillos, lo que le permitirá conservar de manera optima los insumos que utiliza en la preparación y tener mas orden al exhibir sus productos, con ello seguirá trabajando y luchando para cumplir su mas grande sueño:” Tener su local Propio”.
texts.en:
Santosa is 32 years old. She lives in the city of Pisco, a city that is characterized by beautiful beaches, a warm climate, and one of the most beautiful tourist attractions of our country, the Ballestas Islands and the Candelabro. Santos loves Peruvian food, and one of the dishes that she likes most is the very delicious "aji de gallina" (chili pepper chicken, a Peruvian chicken stew). She is a mother and has two children whose ages are 4 and 14 and whom she loves very much and who are her reason for living. For economic reasons, she could only go to school up to the fifth grade of secondary education, but she would have liked to study gastronomy, because she very much likes to cook.

Thanks to her good cooking skill in preparing dishes, she began her business selling one of the Peruvian flagship dishes, the very delicious ceviche, 11 months ago. Santosa gets up very early to go in search of the ingredients to prepare this dish. She works about eight hours a day and can serve about 30 customers a day. She believes that she is doing well in her business because she is a good cook and furthermore, she treats her customers in a kindly manner.

Santosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to buy a freezer and a display case for the sale of her dishes, which will permit her to store the ingredients that she uses in preparation in an optimal manner and to have more order in showing her products. With it she will continue working and striving to accomplish her greatest dream, "to have her own business location."

loans.use: to buy a freezer and a display case

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 39-year-old widow from Kisumu who has four children aged from fourteen to twenty years.

For the past ten years Amina has sold cereals, making 15,000 KES a month. She is receiving her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stocks of maize, rice, beans and green grams, or mung beans. She will use her profits to educate her children.

Amina’s dream is to own a big cereals shop in Kisumu.

loans.use: To buy stocks of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vegetables, dairy products, bakery goods, sugar, rice and other supplies.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 40-year-old man from Migori County, West of Kenya. He is married to Christine and they have five children aged between five and 18 years.

Thomas operates a brick selling business which he has done for the last five years making a monthly income of KES. 10,000. He is now taking his fourth loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy bricks for sale. 

He will use the anticipated profits to pay the loan from KADET. His dream is to live well and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy bricks for sale.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 37 year old man from Kisumu City and is married to Everlyne and they have six children whose ages are between two and 12 years old.

Benjamin operates a retail stall selling various items like watches and wallets. He has been in this business for the last 13 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy a stock of sunglasses, watches and wallets. 

His profits will be used to educate his children. His dream is to have a big business in Kisumu City.

loans.use: To buy stock of sunglasses, watches and wallets.

loans.name: Ditha

texts.en:
Ditha lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of them are still in school. 

Ditha heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 in order to purchase rice  and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Bebilyn

texts.en: And now, Bebilyn is borrowing Php 12,000 to fund her vegetable farming business. The vegetables garden that she previously funded through KIVA partner and NWTF continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm tools.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama a 40 ans, mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle commercialise des produits de la brasserie. Dans le souci de mieux fournir ses produits à ses clients en vue de les satisfaire, elle est venue auprès de Finadev demandée une aide financière pour atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: Mariama is 40 years old and a married mother of four children. She markets brewery products. Concerned about furnishing more of her products to her customers, so as to satisfy them, Mariama has come to Finadev asking for financial aid to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy 16 cases of brewery products

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Rowena has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Rose is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. Rose has been working hard to manage her salon which does hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy hair braids for resale and will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rose's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy hair braids for resale

loans.name: Afuraha

texts.en:
Afuraha is a 28 year old business man who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children between the ages of 5 and 1. One of the children goes to school. 

Afuraha runs a mixed store business, and he has been in the business for one year.  He has no employees. Afuraha heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officer’s word of mouth promotion done in the market. He is taking a loan of 1000 to purchase more items like, sweets, try cells,  wool and many others. In addition to this business, Afuraha has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Afuraha hopes to have a big business at least in his own good building. 

His major challenges include the high standard of living in Juba and feeding his only child.

Afuraha says that, "He has only thanks given to finance south Sudan for the support."

loans.use: to purchase more items like sweets, try cells, wool and many others to sell.

loans.name: Level One Group

texts.en:
Tabu, who is in his late 30s is married with three children who are still going to school. He has been running a grocery business for three years now.  He works from 9.00 am to 11.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use for increasing his stock of beer, spirits, wines, and sodas. His dream is to one day be able to buy enough tables and chairs.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Level One" who has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase his stock of beer, spirits, wines, and sodas.

loans.name: Dinora Berenice

texts.es:
La señora Dinora se dedica a la venta de accesorios para dama que son bolsas, aretes, collares,  zapatos, esta solicitando un crédito para invertir en comprar de mercancía ya que por la temporada navideña se quedo sin productos para vender y desea comprar mercancía de verano, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar a cabo esta inversión en su negocio. Ya que todo lo que vendió se lo pagan en abonos. 
Dinora es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de mediana edad que actualmente están estudiando y desea mejorar la calidad de vida y que tengan un mejor futuro.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio. Ya que tiene otro ingreso que es de su empleo en las oficinas de vialidad publica de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Señora Dinora sells women's accessories such as purses, earrings, necklaces, and shoes. She is applying for a loan to invest in buying merchandise, since she was left without products to sell because of the Christmas season, and she wants to buy summer merchandise, but she does not have the necessary money to make this investment in her business, since everything that she sold is being paid for in installments.

Dinora is a single mother with two children who are now in school, and she wants to improve their quality of life and for them to have a better future.

She plans to pay off the loan with the earnings that she obtains from her business, since she has another income, which is from her job in the offices of the public highway department of the city.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her women's accessories business

loans.name: Hugo Orlando

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo tiene 34 años y es soltero y no tiene hijos, se dedica al servicio de amplificación, el vive en la zona de  bajo Pampahasi, este es el primer préstamo que tiene con la institución, el Sr. Hugo usara este préstamo para la compra de una computadora que ayudara a su negocio y de esta manera mejora de tecnología el Sr. Hugo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia masiva y el va a utilizar los beneficios actualizando la  tecnología de sonido para así brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes, ya que es muy conocido en la zona porque ameniza todo tipo de acontecimiento sociales, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que a gracias a su apoyo seguirá creciendo en su actividad.
texts.en: Hugo is 34 years old, single and has no children. He makes a living in providing sound-system services. He lives in the Bajo Pampahasi area. This is his first loan through this institution, and Hugo plans to use it to purchase a computer to help his business with improved technology. His business faces a challenge of massive competition, and he will benefit from upgrading his technology by providing better sound to his costumers. He is well known in the area because he works all kinds of social events. He feels grateful for the support being provided because thanks to your help he will continue to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es madre soltera de 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad, ella tiene 45 años de edad y tiene casa propia, el caserío en el que vive es pequeño de aproximadamente unas 40 familias dedicadas a la agricultura y ganadería. El caserío en el que vive se llama “Las Pampas“ el cual pertenece al distrito de Olmos a dos horas de la Ciudad de Chiclayo. Pues gracias al esfuerzo de sus habitantes ya su caserío ha logrado construir su propio colegio y su capilla, faltándoles por ahora obtener el servicio de agua potable pues solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica.

Celia se dedica a venta de prendas de vestir, pues a esta actividad ya se viene dedicando un aproximado de  5 años, cuanta con sus clientes fijos quienes la visitan a su propio domicilio para realizar sus pedidos, adicionalmente y complementariamente a sus mismo clientes les ofrece productos de belleza para lo que sale de caserío en caserío a ofrecer sus diferentes productos.

Celia solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de mas prendas de vestir, las cuales serán enviadas por un familiar desde la Ciudad de Lima, pues considera de que aun tiene mercado por captar.

Ella se ha dispuesto en mejorar su negocio con el fin de generarse mayores ingresos para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Celia is the single mother of two children who are minors. She is 45 and has her own house. The settlement where she lives is small; approximately 40 families who make their living farming and raising livestock. The settlement where she lives is called Las Pampas, which is part of the Olmos district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

Thanks to the efforts of its inhabitants, her settlement has already managed to build its own school and chapel. For now, they are lacking potable water service, since they only have electricity service.

Celia sells articles of clothing and has been doing this work for approximately five years. She has her regular customers who visit her at her home to place orders. In addition, and to supplement this, she sells beauty products to the same customers, for which she goes from settlement to settlement to offer her various products.

Celia is applying for to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan in the amount of 2,000 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy more articles of clothing. These will be sent by a family member from the city of Lima, as she believes that she still has a market to capture. She has resolved to improve her business, with the aim of generating greater income, in order to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothing to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock of home products for sale.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La Sra.  Saturnina  tiene 51 años es madre soltera con dos hijos uno en edad escolar y la otra casada con hijos. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la compra y venta de mercaderías que traía de Clorinda, Argentina, y con los ahorros abrió un local de ventas de comestibles ubicado frente a un colegio de su localidad, sus mayores clientes son alumnos y profesores.
Su hija mayor la ayuda con el negocio, de vez en cuando realiza viajes a la argentina para traer mercaderías ya que hasta ahora tiene pedidos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de panificados, carnes, aceites, verduras y demás insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que sirve en el comedor.
texts.en: Saturnina is a 51-year-old single mother of two children, one who is in school and one who is married with children. Previously she made a living buying and selling merchandise that she brought in from Clorinda, Argentina, and with her savings she opened up a food stand in front of the local school. Her biggest customers are students and teachers. Her oldest daughter helps her with the business. Once in a while she travels to Argentina to bring back merchandise because she still gets orders. Saturnina is requesting the loan to purchase bread products, meats, oils, vegetables and other ingredients to make the meals she serves at the stand.

loans.use: to purchase bread products, meat, oil, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Sévérine

texts.fr: Agée de 47ans, Sévérine est mariée et mère de sept enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente de divers, charbons, bissap et de la glace à son domicile. En vue de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un micro-crédit à Finadev pour renforcer son activité et pour le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en: Sévérine, 47, is married and the mother of seven children.  She sells various goods including charcoal, "bissap" (hibiscus flower tea) and ice, from her home.  In order to meet her customers' needs, she is requesting a microloan from Finadev.  Her goal is to boost her business and to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of charcoal and 50 cosmetic products of all types.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 28 años y es soltera con 1 hijo que tiene  4 años.  Se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante,  Este préstamo es el primer crédito que tiene con la institución, la Sra. Mery usara este préstamo para la compra de mercadería pantalones para estas fiestas de carnaval donde tiene mucha venta, la Sra. Mery  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia y alza de precios utilizara los beneficios reinvertirlos en su negocio como hizo con las ganancias del anterior crédito. El deseo de la Sra. Mery es hacer crecer  su negocio y ampliar sus productos a electrodomésticos ya que traería dichos productos de la ciudad de Oruro pero esto después ya que  necesita más capital, La Sra. Mery se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mery is 28 years old, single and has a 4-year-old son. She makes a living selling clothing outdoors. This is her first loan with this institution, and she plans to use it to purchase pants for carnival parties, where she has a lot of sales. Mery confronts business risks like competition and high margins by reinvesting in her business, like she did with the profits from a previous loan. Mery's wish is to grow her business and expand to household appliances, which are brought in from the city of Oruro but require more capital. Mery feels grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase pants for carnival parties.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Carmela has a shop that sells vegetables like carrots, cabbages amd eggplants. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

Carmela has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana es de la ciudad de Pilar,  es casada, es comerciante, posee un centro comercial donde comercializa todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, artículos de bazar, ropería, etc.
Comenta que su marido la ayuda con los gastos de la casa, el tiene una empresa de servicios, y cuenta con camiones volquetes para realizar trabajos de obras viales, etc.
Ana nos cuenta que se dedica a este negocio hace 10 años, por lo que experiencia en lo que hace le obra, y quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio, pues desea poder comprar prendas de vestir, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad recibida.
texts.en:
Ana is from the city of Pilar. She is married, a merchant, and owns a store where she sells all types of basic goods, such as stationery, clothing, etc. She says that her husband helps her with the household expenses. He has a service company and has dump trucks for doing construction and transportation projects, etc.

Ana tells us that she has been in her business for ten years, so she has experience with what works and she wants to continue investing in her business.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She would like to buy clothing garments so that she can stock her business. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 32-year-old married man and the father of three children. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. His educational background is primary school only. His business is a cafeteria, which he has been running for seven years. He offers his customers all types of staple products, such as hot drinks, fresh juices and sandwiches. In addition, he has employed two workers in his business.

He started as a worker in the same business. Then he strived to collect more money in order to buy the business. The business allows him to support his family. Mohammed says that he is already established with customers in the area and highly esteemed by his neighbors and customers, who consider him a responsible man. He has been able to attract his clients because he makes all types of delicious foods and tasty juices.

Mohammed wants to acquire more products with which he can grow his business in order to achieve his objective. So he applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB to buy food items such as beans, sugar, cheese, eggs and fruits 
 
In the future, Mohammed would like to send his children to high school as well as open a new cafeteria in a strategic place.

loans.use: to buy food items such as beans, sugar, cheese, eggs and fruits

loans.name: Mahukpego Group

texts.fr: MAHUKPEGO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres exercent leur activité dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Louise Martine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans. Louise Martine est mariée à un certain Emmanuel. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Louise Martine, Pour subvenir à ses besoins, vend depuis près d’une dizaine d’année des produits de la quincaillerie et de façon secondaire la vente de cartes de recharge téléphonique au Benin. Louise Martine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Louise Martine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Louise Martine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO. les trois crédits consentis ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MAHUKPEGO is a group which consists of three members who work in the same neighborhood.  Louise Martine is the representative of the group and she is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is 37 years old and married to a man named Emmanuel.  The couple has five children, all in their care, and all in school.  

In order to take care of her own needs, Louise Martine has been selling hardware products, and additionally, rechargeable phone cards, in Benin, for about ten years.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

Wishing to expand her business and to be more competitive on the market, her goal is to increase her stock of merchandise. This will allow her to increase her turnover and income.  For this reason, she and the other members of the MAHUKPEGO group are requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.  Three previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy hardware items and rechargeable phone cards.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlina is 43 years old and has seven children who are in school.

Merlina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merlina requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy nylon strings, fishing nets and gasoline for her fishing boat.

Merlina has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Merlina would like to save enough money to buy an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy nylon strings, fishing nets and gasoline for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is a married woman. Her husband works as a mason. Pili operates a food stall business and sells her goods as retail. She's worked in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. 

Pili's other source of income includes her side job as a tailor. She describes her greatest business challenge as the high cost of transportation and her highest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Pili will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase wheat flour, rice, cooking oil and coconut. She aspires to become self reliant in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, cooking oil and coconut.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Vilma has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Vilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 31 years old, married and the father of four children who live in Aden, Yemen. His educational background is Bachelor of Commerce.

Ahmed is very hardworking. With much great effort and dedication, he managed to save money and forge his business, which today is a general store. He works around 12 hours daily. He said that without sacrifice, there is no reward and if one wants to get ahead, you have to do what you can. He believes that his business is going well because his family is his best motivation. Additionally, they are very close and all cooperate in order to move forward. Due to the bad situation in Yemen, his business is unable to increase profits as he did previously, so he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy more merchandise such as soft drinks, breads, chocolates, eggs, beans and milk to be able to offer a wider variety of products. With this loan, he will be able to have increased profits in order to achieve his goal.

In the future, he hopes to give his profession to his children and better the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, chocolates, eggs, beans and milk to sell

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh is a 58-year-old woman. She has eight children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working in a supermarket. Khanh has been running a business selling beverages for nine years. 

Khanh would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of beverages to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of beverages.

loans.name: Marguérite Yèyinou

texts.fr: Marguérite Yèyinou est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un vitrier du nom de Lazare. Le couple a deux enfants, tous  scolarisés et à leur charge. Marguérite Yèyinou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Marguérite Yèyinou a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Il y a près de quatre ans que Marguérite Yèyinou mène comme activité, la vente des produits cosmétiques et des boissons dans  une ville du Benin. Marguérite Yèyinou s'approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Marguérite Yèyinou sollicite une troisième fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Marguérite Yèyinou is 31 years old and married to a glazier named Lazare.  The couple has two children, both in school and both their dependents.  Marguérite Yèyinou lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various family expenses with her husband.

Marguérite Yèyinou left school at the secondary level.  She has been selling cosmetic products and drinks in a town in Benin, for almost four years.  She buys her merchandise in a town in Benin.

In order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover, she is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the third time.  Her two previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, other cosmetic products, and drinks.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.en:
Geronimo is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Geronimo has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan for 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Geronimo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Geronimo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Magogoni Group

texts.en:
Kudra, who is in her early 50s, is married with two children who are still going to school. She has been a food vendor for seven years now. She works from 6.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used her previous loan to restock missing items in her food business, saved a small portion in the bank and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to increase her food stock so she can sell more food to more people. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Magogoni" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her food stock so she can sell more food to more people.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah is taking out another Kiva loan amounting to Kshs 20,000. With the loan, she wants to establish another retail shop business, so she will purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She dreams of becoming self reliant in the future. Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for supporting her to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Bondo

texts.en:
Bondo is 36 years old. He lives in the village of Koghoto, East Georgia, with his family: his wife, Ia, and his 3-year-old daughter. 

Bondo works as driver and guide. He provides transportation and guide service to tourists visiting his region. Ia is leading the agricultural business of the family, and Bondo helps as well. The family owns a small pig farm with three pigs and piglets. They sell on average 30 piglets per year in the village. Along with the pig farm, the family also owns 3 hectare of land where maize and vine-trees are grown. Maize is sold on the local market to retailers and harvested grapes are sold to the local wine producers' factories. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,100 Laris. 

Bondo requested credit for initiating a new family business – a dairy farm. With the requested credit, he will purchase two milk cows. Ia will produce cheese and sell on average 40 kg of traditional Georgian cheese on the local market to dairy product retailers. The income of the family will increase by 300 Laris. They will use part of the income for further development of the family agricultural business, and the remaining will be used for purchasing additional household goods to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows for the start-up of a dairy farm.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 41 years old. She has seven children aged between 3 and 19 years, all of whom go to school. She has been in the business of making clothes since she began working as a tailor 11 years ago. With the loan, Vestine will buy fabrics from which she will make clothes to sell. She plans to use the profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for making clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nimpha

texts.en:
Nimpha is 44 years old, is married and lives in the Philippines. She has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Avon and Boardwalk. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy stocks from Avon and Boardwalk to sell.

Nimpha has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from Avon and Boardwalk to sell

loans.name: Wanyina Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANYINA est formé de trois personnes qui exercent les mêmes activités à l’Eglise. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Christine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Christine est âgée de 41ans et est mariée à un marchand du nom de Thomas. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge, et dont certains sont scolarisés. Christine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Christine n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a trente ans que Christine mène comme activité, la vente de plastiques et de produits divers (condiments, riz, etc.) dans une ville du Benin. Christine s'approvisionne au Togo et parfois au Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire,  Christine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANYINA, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The WANYINA group consists of three members who are involved in the same Church activities.  Christine is the representative of the group and she is raising her hand in the photo.  She is 41 years old and married to a seller named Thomas.  The couple has four children, all in their care.  Some of their children attend school.  Christine lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various family expenses with her husband.

Christine never attended school.  For the past thirty years, she has been selling items made of plastic and various other items such as condiments, rice, etc. in a town in Benin.  She buys her goods in Togo and sometimes in Benin.

In order to meet the needs of her customers and to increase her turnover, she is requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the WANYINA group.  The loans that were previously received have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy various items such as rice, condiments, and plastic products.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is aged 39. Her husband works as a businessman. They have four children, all of whom go to school. Jacqueline has been selling ladies' clothes for the past six years. With the loan she plans to buy more clothes for ladies. With the profits, she will renovate the house. She dreams of having a prosperous business, because most of the ladies like the clothing that she sells.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman. Her husband works as a businessman. Fatuma operates a charcoal selling business and sells her goods from home. She has worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. 

Fatuma's other source of income involves operating a green-grocery business. She describes her greatest business challenge as being the high cost of transportation and her highest monthly expenses are food and rent bills. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Fatuma will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal. She aspires to become self reliant in the future. Fatuma joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en: Alphonse is 30 years old. He is the father of two children who are aged eight months and two years. He sells men's shoes and has been running this business for the past 10 years. With the loan, Alphonse will buy more used shoes to sell. He plans to use the profits to expand the business through reinvesting in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ruthcelyn

texts.en:
Ruthcelyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Ruthcelyn is making & peddling boiled fresh corn. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fresh corn to sell.

Ruthcelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ruthcelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh corn to sell

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Cerila has a shop that makes and sells snacks like banana and sweet potato cue (sweet snacks). She has had this business for 15 years. She  has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Cerila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en: Jeanette is 35 years old. She has three children, two of whom attend school regularly. Jeanette has been selling fish for 13 years. She wants the loan to buy more fish to sell so she can expand her business. With the profits, she wants to buy iron sheets for her house roofing.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.
 
Rogelio is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Rogelio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rogelio hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline for his business

loans.name: Protogene

texts.en: Protogene is 42 years old. He does not yet have children. He has spent 20 years in the business of selling both alcoholic drinks and soft drinks in a bar. Due to his high motivation to achieve a good result, he has decided to request a loan to buy more beers and sodas to sell. He says that, with the profits, he will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more alcoholic drinks and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Anecia

texts.en:
Anecia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children.
 
Anecia makes and peddles snacks like pancakes, hot cakes and rice cakes. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks .

Anecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Lany

texts.en:
Lany is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Lany has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy stocks for the store and ingredients for making snacks.

Lany has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks for the store and ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Jeamar

texts.en:
Jeamar is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child. 

Jeamar provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for two years. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.

Jeamar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Rosanna has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rosanna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Jenelyn has a shop that sells clothing like shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy clothing like shirts, blouses and underwear to sell.

Jenelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing like shirts, blouses and underwear to sell

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón tiene 35 años, está casado con la Sra. Mirta, ellos tiene dos hijos, quienes son los que motivan a la pareja a luchar.
Ramón es de profesión macatero (vendedor ambulante), empezó con la actividad  hace más de 15 años, por lo cual nos dice que cuenta con clientela formada, vende por la zona de Paraguarí.
El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se esfuerza siempre el doble para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan para no tener que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de hebillas, prendas, frazadas y demás productos. Agradece a la fundación por la ayuda que le está dando, pues le será muy provechosa.
texts.en:
Ramón is 35 years old, and is married to Senora Mirta. They have two children, who are the motivation behind the couple's determination. Ramón is a professional macatero (street vendor). He began working in this way more than 15 years ago, and has a regular clientele in the Paraguarí area.
He defines himself as a hardworking and enterprising man, always striving to give his family everything they need and save them from any hardship.
The credit he is seeking is for the purchase of buckles, clothing, blankets and other products. He is grateful to the foundation for the help it is offering, which will be very beneficial.

loans.use: to buy buckles, clothing, blankets and other products

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COPO DE NIEVE” iniciará su decimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margui es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Comercio, producción, servicios y venta de manta de vicuña. 

La señora Margui indica que hace ocho ciclos que integra en Pro Mujer  ingresando por invitación de amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas de manta de vicuña que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su suegra.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el crecimiento de su negocio (compra de mantas de vicuña) que adquirirá de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializara en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y capacitación.
texts.en:
The "Snowflake" communal bank is beginning its fifteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer. It is composed of eight members and is headed by a board where Señora Margui is Secretary. The businesses operated by members of the communal bank are varied. Among them are: trade, production, services and the sale of vicuña blankets.

Señora Margui has been part of eight loan cycles with Pro Mujer, having got involved following an invitation by friends. Currently she has a business selling vicuña blankets. She has been in this line of work for many years, learning her trade from her mother in law.

The loan will help her to grow her business, by buying vicuña fleeces in El Alto. When she has woven the wool into blankets she sells them on her stall. This workflow allows her to generate income to help support her family, as she is married and has one son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the work they do on ​​health, and the training they provide.

loans.use: To buy vicuña fleeces

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en:
Thuan, a 49-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. She and her husband earn a living running a general store that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Thuan requests a loan to purchase more products such as soaps, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she hopes she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as soaps, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo to stock her store

loans.name: Genita

texts.en:
Genita is 40 years old, married to Henry, and blessed with five children ages 20, 18, 15, 13 and 10 years, respectively. She owns rental houses, a business she started six years ago, and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

She has requested a loan for 40,000 KES to purchase bricks for constructing more rental houses. The profit earned will be put back into her business. Her dream is to live a happy life. This is her second loan.

loans.use: to purchase bricks for constructing more rental houses.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 20 years old and a single mother of a three year old child.

Naomi operates a retail stall selling various items like wallets, caps, and belts. She has been running this business for the last three years, making a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of sunglasses, belts and caps for sale. Her profits will be used to repay the loan.

Her dream is to have a big clothing business in Kisumu town.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sunglasses, belts and caps and for sale.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for four years. She is 36 year olds, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Lilly heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 South Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia lives in Yei. She sells food and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are still in school. 

Emelia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 South Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for sale.

loans.name: Rebelyn

texts.en:
Rebelyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Rebelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rebelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rebelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Someth

texts.en: Someth, 33, is married and resides with her parents, her husband, and two children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately $6 USD per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns approximately $5 USD per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Someth is requesting a loan of $500 USD to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to use further profits to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide comfortable living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, in order to generate more income to supporting her family.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Sokhorn, 55, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a carpenter who earns approximately $5 USD per day. One of her children is employed in the garment factory and earns about $3 USD per day. She wants to build a new house. With this goal in mind, Sokhom is requesting a loan of $700 USD to purchase timber for constructing her house. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for constructing her house

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Yei. She runs a food stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Agnes heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan for 700 South Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes & onions for sale.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 62-year-old widow. Two years ago she opened a small cosmetics and accessories shop to spend her free time and make her own living.

Salwa used to be a school manager, but she retired at the age of 60. She couldn't imagine herself without work, so she opened her own small business. Salwa is a hardworking woman. She was responsible of raising her daughter since her husband passed away. She did quite a good job.

To improve her business, Salwa applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business capital with special accessories, cosmetics and perfumes. Salwa is very sure that this loan will help in fulfilling her customers' needs and desires.

She hopes to stay in good health and to continue making a living without asking for others' help.

loans.use: to increase her business capital with special accessories, cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
This is Redentor, 37, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is a widower with one child. He manages their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Redentor operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 Philippine pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Redentor hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Secundina

texts.es:
La Sra. Secundina es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 52 años, es separada con 6 hijos, 3 varones y 3 mujeres todos/as ya son adultos y todos trabajan. La señora es muy trabajadora tiene su establecimiento en una comunidad en donde tiene sus animales vacunos y sus cultivos.
Según cuenta la señora le fue muy difícil criar y educar a todos sus hijos, ya que ella se encontraba solo, pero gracias al esfuerzo y empeño que ella y sus otros hijos pusieron, supieron salir adelante y en la actualidad la mayoría de sus hijos ya son profesionales. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora, que toda su vida se ha esforzado por darle a su familia lo mejor.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado para la cría, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia. Está muy contenta con la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y kiva le dan.
texts.en:
Sra. Secundina hails from the city of Concepción. She is 52 years old and is separated from her partner. She has 6 grown-up children: 3 men and 3 women who all work. The Señora is an entrepreneurial lady who works in the community, where she has raises cows and grows crops.
The Señora tells us that it was difficult for her to raise and educate all her children as she was on her own but, owing to the efforts and determination of herself and her other children, she managed to get by.
