Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. De façon secondaire, Djidjoho fait de la transformation de noix de palme en huile de palme. Djidjoho désire mieux équiper son atelier de couture par l’acquisition d’une nouvelle machine à coudre et des fournitures de couture ; ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Djidjoho sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Djidjoho, age 42, lives in Benin. He's married to a merchant named Célestine. Djidjoho dropped out of elementary school, and learned sewing. The couple has four children, who all attend school. In addition, the couple has another child in its care.

Djidjoho and his wife make sure together that the various household expenses are covered. To this effect, Djidjoho has been working as a tailor for about five years. This business enables him to provide for himself and for his children's needs.

As a secondary business, Djidjoho also transforms palm nuts into palm oil. He wants to improve his workshop's equipment by purchasing a new sewing machine and sewing supplies. This will enable him to meet customer demand in an efficient way.

For this reason, he's seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The first loan was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, sewing supplies, and palm nuts

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
This is Nena, 34, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Angel, her business partner, and is a mother with three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Nena operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a common family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend money on cooking gas and food for one or two persons, when buying cooked rice and other foods cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 38,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and also frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nena dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Antonio Dolores

texts.es: Antonio Dolores de sesenta y un años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee una venta de artículos varios en una zona muy concurrida de personas, últimamente ha aumentado la demanda de sus productos, ya que todos son de excelente calidad y los vende a precios accesibles, además el servicio es muy bueno, Antonio se porta muy amable con toda la clientela que lo visita, es un hombre entregado a su trabajo, siempre se mantiene muy enérgico y con ganas de estar adelante de su competencia, piensa que los mas grandes secretos para alcanzar el triunfo son la constancia y la dedicación, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar juguetes, carteras, esmaltes, papel de regalo, cintas para zapatos entre otros. Antonio Dolores tiene la confianza de que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: 71-year-old Antonio Dolores lives with his life partner and children.  He has a store where he sells a variety of merchandise.  The store is located in a very busy area.  Demand for his products has recently increased as the goods he sells are all excellent quality and he offers them at affordable prices.  In addition, his customer service is very good.  Antonio is very kind to his customers and committed to his work.  He always remains very energetic and keen to stay ahead of the competition.  He believes that the big secrets to success are perseverance and commitment.  He decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to buy toys, wallets, nail polish, gift wrap, laces, etc.  Antonio Dolores is certain that this will enable him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy toys, wallets, nail polish, gift wrap, shoelaces, etc.

loans.name: Aurelia Brenda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Aurelia, tiene 40 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo cinco  hijos de 23, 21, 18, 14  y 6 años de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa y estudian en universidad, colegio y  escuela.
 
Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto sacar a sus hijos adelante  se dedica a la venta de ropa y de productos de Lebel, Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale la mayoría de los días a recorrer la ciudad con sus productos ya que algo tiene que vender en el transcurso del día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, la ropa la compra en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viaja cada vez que ella necesita mercadería. Tiene más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde hace 11 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The San Pedro communal bank meets every two weeks in San Pedro in Manta city.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular throughout the whole year, and also for being a city with unmatched beauty and a lot of tourist attractions.

This is where we meet Aurelia, age 40.  Her husband died several years ago.  She has five children, ages 23, 21, 18, 14, and 6.  Three of them still live in her house and go to the university, high school, and elementary school.

She is a homemaker.  In order to get her own means of support to get her children ahead she sells clothes and Lebel and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  Most days she leaves to make her rounds in the city with her products because something has to be sold during the course of the day.  She leaves her products on credit, and she collects once a week.  

She buys the clothes in the city of Guayaquil, which is where she goes each time she needs merchandise.  She has been doing this business activity for over seven years, and it is going very well for her.

The loan is to buy clothes, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.  She has been in her communal bank for 11 years.  She likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to have a car to make her rounds.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marcel Evènassè Jean

texts.fr: Marcel Evènassè Jean est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Marcel Evènassè Jean est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Hélène. Marcel Evènassè Jean n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la couture. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Marcel Evènassè Jean et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Marcel Evènassè Jean exerce le métier de couture depuis treize ans environs. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Marcel Evènassè Jean désire mieux équiper son atelier de couture par l’acquisition d’une machine à broder ; ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Marcel Evènassè Jean sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Marcel Evènassè Jean, age 32, lives in Benin. He's married to a hairdresser named Hélène. He never attended school, but did learn sewing. The couple has two children, out of whom one attends school. In addition, they have another child in their care.

Marcel Evènassè Jean and his wife make sure together that the various household expenses are covered. To provide for himself, Marcel Evènassè Jean has been working as a tailor for about thirteen years. This business enables him to provide for himself and for his children's needs.

He would like to improve his sewing workshop's equipment by purchasing an embroidery machine. This will enable him to meet customer demand in an efficient way.

For this reason, Marcel Evènassè Jean is seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The first two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: María Delmi

texts.es: María Delmi de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas en el lugar de su residencia, es muy conocida en la localidad ya que vende las tortillas mas ricas, con materia prima de primera calidad y a precios bajos, además el servicio es el mas rápido de la zona; María es una mujer entregada a su labor se levanta desde muy temprano pues sabe que al que madruga Dios le ayuda, quiere mantenerse adelante de la competencia y la perseverancia es su mas grande secreto para hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, leña, cal, gas propano, etc. María Delmi tiene la esperanza que así podrá regalarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Delmi is 43 years old and lives with her life partner and children in her own home.  She has a tortilla business at home and is very well known in her town because she sells delicious tortillas, using top-quality ingredients and selling at low prices.  In addition, her service is the fastest in the area.  María is a woman who is committed to her work.  She gets up very early as she knows that God helps those who get up early.  She would like to stay ahead of the competition and perseverance is her biggest secret to growing her business.  She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy corn wholesale, firewood, lime, propane gas, etc.  María Delmi hopes to be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale, firewood, lime and propane gas

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: José, humilde, padre de familia, trabaja como guardia de seguridad, su esposa profesora, juntos tienen que velar por el futuro de sus hijos y el bienestar actual. Tiene dentro de sus planes construir su vivienda completamente de concreto cambiando poco a poco la construcción actual y ampliando las arias de cuartos así sus hijos tendrán individualidad y no estar todos juntos como ahora. Nuestro cliente ya lleva adelantado alguna parte de la construcción del cuarto pero se le ha presentado dificultades por la cual no pudo seguir por su cuenta propia, ha encontrado en la financiera el apoyo necesario para cumplir su proyecto.  Invirtiendo el préstamo en la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, bloques, estribu, perlines, laminas de zinc, tablones, alambre de amarre, piedras canteras, entre otros materiales construyendo así las paredes y entechado la casa. Agradece la oportunidad de construir su cuarto, obteniendo mayor seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en: José, a humble family man, works as a security guard. His wife is a teacher. Together they have to look out for the future of their children and their current well-being. He has plans to build his house completely of concrete, changing the current construction little by little, and enlarging the area of the rooms so that his children can have their own space and not be all together like they are now. Our client has already moved forward with part of the room construction, but it has presented difficulties for him, so he could not continue on his own account. In financing, he has found the necessary support to complete his project. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials: cement, sand, iron, gravel, blocks, supports, purlins, zinc roofing sheets, planks, rebar tie wire, and quarry stone, among other materials, to build the walls and put a roof on the house. He is thankful for the opportunity to build his room and obtain greater security and comfort.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ruth Arely

texts.es: Ruth Arely de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de partes de motos en el lugar de su residencia y últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio es excelente; Ruth es una mujer enérgica con ganas de salir adelante y cumplir sus objetivos, piensa que la disciplina y el amor a lo que haces te dan la fuerza para lograr el éxito y es con ese pensamiento que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar partes de motos. Ruth Arely tiene fe que así logrará darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Ruth Arely is 43 years old. She lives with her partner and their children in their own house. She owns a motorcycle parts shop in her place of residence. Lately she has made lots of customers as everything she deals with is good quality and at reasonable prices. Also, her service is excellent. 

Ruth is an energetic woman who is eager to get ahead and fulfil her goals. She thinks that discipline and love are what give you the strength to achieve success. With that thought she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy motorcycle spare parts. Ruth Arely has faith that with this she will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle sapre parts.

loans.name: Miriam Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Miriam, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 11 años el mismo que estudian en escuela. El marido es pintor de barcos. 

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatillas y zapatos por catalogo. Su forma de venta es ofrecer con su revista y luego cuando ya tenga varios pedidos envía el pedido el mismo que le llega al otro dia y luego se encarga de entregar, estos productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada 15 días. Lleva dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, así ella se gana algo por su cuenta y se siente útil.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatillas, zapatos y sobretodo sandalias de temporada. Lleva tres años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The San Pedro communal bank meets every two weeks in San Pedro in Manta city.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular throughout the whole year.  It is also known for being a city with unmatched beauty and a lot of tourist attractions.

This is where Miriam, age 25, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has an eleven year old son who goes to school.  Her husband paints boats.  She is a homemaker.  In order to obtain her own income and help her husband with the household expenses she sells slippers and shoes by catalog.  

The way that she sells is by offering items with her magazine.  Then, when she has several orders, she sends in the order.  When the order comes, she then delivers it.  She leaves these products on credit, and she collects every two weeks.  She has been doing this business activity for two years, and it is going very well for her.

This way she earns something on her own, and she feels useful.

She will use the loan to buy slippers, shoes, and mostly seasonal sandals.  She has been in her communal bank for three years.  She likes it because of the help that she gets with the loans.

Her dream is to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy slippers, shoes, and sandals.

loans.name: Rawi

texts.en:
Rawi is a 41-year-old man and is married to Kasmiati, a 36-year-old lady. They have five children, namely: Erwinda, 19, Wildayanti, 18; Aditya, 14, and attending 2nd grade of Junior High School; Bara, 11, attending 6th grade of Elementary School; Fika, 6, attending 1st grade of Elementary School. 

Rawi is an immigrant from Java. He initiated a timber construction business in 2002. Rawi employs seven assistants in running the business. Rawi sells plank wood, rafters, and beams in large quantity and different sizes. In addition, he offers a wood sawmill service as well. 

At the moment Rawi has received an order to provide a certain amount of teak wood but unfortunately he does not have enough stock to meet the order. Therefore, Rawi is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. He would like to spend the loan on teak wood. He is hoping that he can receive the loan soon.

loans.use: to purchase teak wood for resale

loans.name: Hercules

texts.es:
Hércules tiene 27 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive junto a su esposa en el caserío rural llamado “CP- 3 “del distrito de Tambogrande, es un caserío pequeño donde la actividad económica principal es la ganadería y agricultura. Por ahora su caserío solo cuenta con el servicio de luz eléctrica.

Actualmente se dedica a la crianza engorde y comercialización de ganado menor y aves de corral en su mayoría, en el caserío donde vive existe bastante competencia en el rubro que se desempeña pero también hay mucha demanda por lo que ya el se ha generado sus clientes, recorre no solo mercados locales si no que también sale a mercados de otros caseríos, y es de su esposa que recibe ayuda para lograr sus objetivos debido a que quieren mejorar su calidad de vida.

Hércules desea comprar alimentos balanceados para su mejor crecimiento y engorde de sus animales para poder ponerlos a mejor precio, por lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles para cumplir con sus objetivos.
Es un joven emprendedor y muy responsable, características conocidas por ser un cliente recurrente para nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Hercules is 27 years old. He has one child and lives with his wife in the rural area called "CP-3" of the Tambogrande district. It is a small hamlet where its main economic activities are agriculture and livestock. At the moment his hamlet only has electric services.

At the moment he makes a living raising, fattening and selling mainly small livestock and poultry. In the hamlet where he lives there is quite a lot of competition in this sector that he works in. However, there is also a large demand and he has made customers. He doesn't only travel round the local markets but also goes to markets in other areas. He also receives help from his wife to be able to meet his objectives as they want to improve their quality of life.

Hercules wants to buy balanced feed for his animals to improve their growth and fatten them in order to sell them at a better price. This is why he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the amount of 1000 PEN; to fulfil his objectives.

He is an enterprising, very responsible young man, which are qualities that are attested to by his being a regular client with our institution.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed so his animals will be well fed.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto Carlos de veintisiete años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee una panadería muy conocida en la zona, vende pan en variedad semitas, quesadillas, pastelitos, pan salado entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente, pues lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Roberto es un hombre entusiasta siempre dispuesto a trabajar duro para salir adelante, piensa que el triunfo del verdadero hombre, surge de una base de trabajo bien cimentada, quiere llegar al éxito es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina, azúcar, levadura, leche, dulce etc. Roberto Carlos tiene la esperanza de que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos, age 27, lives with his life partner and their children.  He has a very well-known bakery in the area.  He sells a variety of bread, tarts, quesadillas, and pastries, among others.

He has a lot of customers recently.  What he sells is of a very good quality, and he sells at accessible prices.  Also, the service is excellent.

Roberto is an enthusiastic man who is always ready to work hard in order to get ahead.  He believes that the triumph of a real man arises from a strong foundation of work.  

He wants to be successful.  That is why he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  He will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, milk, and sweeteners, etc.

Roberto Carlos hopes that this way he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, milk, and sweeteners.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon is a fifty-one-year-old married man with seven children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer who does dairy farming and crop production. He would like to become a prominent farmer by doing agriculture on a large scale. He wants to have a healthy and well educated family. Benon wants a loan to buy maize products for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: Having started from produce selling, John is now a proud owner of a bicycle spare parts shop. At the age of 30, he feels his potential is not fully utilized and he wants to deal in motorcycle sales and their spare parts. He wants another loan now to buy bicycle spare parts for resale.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Bonifacia

texts.es: Rosa Bonifacia emprendió su propia herramienta de trabajo con el objetivo de independizarse y inicia el negocio de la venta de  recargas telefónicas, venta de cuajada y alquiler de sillas, frijoles cosidos, el negocio  lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde sus clientes la visitan para comprar su producto. Esta emprendedora ya ha trabajo crédito con Fundación León 2000, ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con buenos valores, actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos para el negocio frijoles, recargas movistar y claro, cuajada, leña, hielo entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Rosa Bonifacia learned the tools for her own business with the objective of becoming independent.  She started a business selling phone charging, selling cuajada (a custard-like sweet) , renting chairs and selling cooked beans.  Her business is located in her home where her customers visit her to purchase her products.

This entrepreneur has already worked with a loan from Fundación León 2000, and has demonstrated that she is a responsible person with good values.  She is currently requesting financing to purchase products for her business: beans, Movistar and Claro phone-chargers, cuajada, firewood and ice among other items.

loans.use: to purchase beans, frijoles, Movistar and Claro phone-chargers, cuajada (a custard-like sweet), firewood and ice among other items.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 35 years old, married, and together the couple has 7 children. Lawrence is a farmer, although he also has a transport business. He has been farming for almost 5 years now. He started by using a hand hoe on a small scale basis and now he uses modern farming equipment. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations and inadequate capital. His family goal is to educate his children and also to buy land for more crop growing.

loans.use: to buy rice and groundnuts for planting.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en: Morris is married with children living in Hioma, Uganda.  He is a farmer and has been farming for 5 years. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations and seasonal variation.  His family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house for his family.  His business goal is to diversify his business and venture into the transport sector.  Morris intends to buy a motorcycle with the loan facility.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Margerette I.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are primary school teachers in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan. With the help of this loan, these teachers will buy goods, invest in businesses or pay the school fees for their children. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Margerette is the leader of this group of teachers. The 49-year-old is a native of Magburaka. She is married to a trader and the couple has two children, one of whom attends secondary school. Margerette has been a professional teacher for 29 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy building materials such as iron and corrugated zinc for the construction of a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as iron and corrugated zinc for the construction of a house for her family.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 29 years old. He lives in the village of Chikaani. George married recently and lives now with his wife, Mtvarisa, his parents and an aunt. His aunt has health problems and receives a relevant pension from the government. 

George and his parents are a leading family agricultural farm, which is the only source of income for the family. They have 4 buffalo. George’s mother uses buffalo milk for the production of cheese, which is quite an expensive product on the local market. 

Also the family owns agricultural land, where watermelon, maize, wheat and vine-trees are grown. During busy agricultural seasons, all family members spend their days on the land doing hard work. They sell harvested products on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,100 Laris.

George requested credit for hiring a tractor for land cultivation and the purchasing of seeds of watermelon and maize. After properly done seasonal work and high quality seeds, he can count on a good harvest, which will be sold at a fair price. It will give the family increased income. George plans to use this increased income for the renovation of their house, which is old and not comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a tractor for land cultivation and to purchase seeds of maize and watermelon.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She also gets additional income from poultry farming at home. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand into a wholesale business and to own 1,000 chickens. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is 56 years old and married with 6 children, living in Hioma, Uganda. Ever since he was a teenager he has been farming, and this has facilitated him in improving his standard of living. However, he faces a challenge of price fluctuations for his farm products. His family goal is to educate his children, while his business wish is to hire employees to help him on his farm. Godfrey needs the loan facility to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis, a 26-year-old married father of three children living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda, is a farmer who has been growing Irish potatoes and maize for three years.  Now requesting a loan to buy Irish potatoes for planting, Francis dreams of educating his children and developing and expanding his plantations.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for planting.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is 30 years old  and he owns a produce business which he started with a capital of 2,500,000 shillings and his business is now worth six million.  He faces hardships of high fuel and transport costs coupled with inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand.  His business goal is to diversify his business and buy land for crop growing.  Johnson intends to use the loan to buy rice and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
This is Annie, age 59, who is a resident of Quezon City in the Philippines. She is married to Erwin, her business partner. She is also a mother to her four children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, cooking oil or an egg. She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Annie is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Annie hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a thirty three year old married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a produce store located in Kamwenge where he has worked for over four years. He started this business with capital worth two hundred fifty thousand shillings and now has three million shillings as  working capital. Daniel faces a problems of customers not paying on time and theft. His personal goal is to buy a car and the business goal is expanding his business into new markets. Daniel needs this loan to buy maize and beans for sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: María Carolina

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Agustín, ciudad conocida por gente trabajadora y sus mujeres hermosas.
 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y frutos de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 16, 14, 9 y 7 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en un colegio y en una escuela  de la localidad. Su esposo se dedica a la cría de animales y al comercio. 

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a sus hijos y a su esposo se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y productos Lebel (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella casi todos los días recorre la ciudad en una  moto de su propiedad realizando sus  ventas y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas, lleva 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien ya que tienen muchos clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar más ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de siete años y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos ella empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener un carro o un local propio.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Calceta, the communal bank San Agustín meets every fifteen days. This city is known for its hard working people and its beautiful women.

Maria lives here. She is 38 years old. She is married and from this relationship has four children of 16, 14, 9 and 7 years of age. They study either in high school or in a local school. Her husband makes a living raising animals and trading.

To earn some money herself and to be able to help her children and her husband she sells clothes and Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). Almost every day she travels round the city on her own motorcycle selling and collecting payments as she sells on credit and collects every week. She has worked in this business for 7 years and now has many customers.

This loan will be used to buy more clothes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and imitation jewelry. She has been in this communal bank for 7 years and she likes it as with one of their loans she started her business.

Her dream is to have a car or her own premises.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and imitation jewelry.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia de cincuenta y ocho años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda en el lugar de su residencia donde vende artículos de primera necesidad como frijoles, leche, pan, embutidos entre otros, últimamente ha aumentado su clientela pues todos sus productos son de muy buena calidad y los vende a excelentes precios, además el servicio es inigualable, Virginia siempre es muy amable con todos; es una mujer muy activa siempre dispuesta a trabajar y a mantenerse adelante de su competencia, piensa que el crecimiento en una labor, es parte de un proceso que te permite llegar al éxito, quiere tener ese éxito y ver crecer su negocio, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, bebidas, productos instantáneos, golosinas, pan, etc. Virginia tiene fe que así podrá llevar a su hogar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Virginia, age 58, lives with her life partner in her own house.  She has a store in her home, and she sells staples like beans, milk, bread, and sausages, among others.  Recently she has more customers because all of her products are very good quality, and she sells at excellent prices.  Also, the service is unbeatable.

Virginia is always very kind to everyone.  She is a very active woman who is always ready to work and to stay ahead of the competition.  She thinks that growth is work.  It is part of a process that will allow her to be successful.  

She wants to have this success and to see her business grow.  That is why she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  The loan will allow her to buy basic grains, drinks, instant products, sweets, and bread, etc.  Virginia has faith that this way she will be able to bring a better quality of life to her household.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, drinks, instant products, sweets, and bread, etc.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is from village Koghoto, East Georgia. He is 40 years old, married and lives with his family: wife – Tea and three daughters (16, 15 and 10 years old). All three children go to school. Gocha is a taxi driver and works in his district with his own car. He also assists Tea in family agricultural farm. The family has two milk cows and a calf. Tea produces cheese and sells on average 45 kg of this product on local market, to dairy products retailers. Also the family owns couple of hens, received eggs are mainly consumed by the family members. Total average monthly income of the family is 850 Laris. 

Gocha requested credit for purchasing two additional milk cows. Tea will be able to double the amount of produced and sold cheese. It will increase the income of the family by 30% and they will be able to create better living conditions for their children and themselves.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Yoram

texts.en: Yoram is a forty year old married man having eight children living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He has a retail shop located in Kamwenge where he has worked for over three years.He started his business with capital worth four hundred thousand shillings and now has capital worth one million shillings. He faces a problem of inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goals are educating children and building a permanent home. His business goal is expanding business into new markets. Yoram needs this loan to buy sodas for sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas to sell.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Hanifa has a business of a hardware shop. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of iron sheets, bags of cement and nails. The main business challenges for Hanifa include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hardware shop and to build her own houses. Hanifa lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bundles of iron sheets, cement and nails.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 45-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has six children. He deals in transportation, where he has worked for over fifteen years. He started as a driver who was hired on a daily basis, and after saving enough wages he bought his own vehicle. 

He faces the problems of high fuel and license costs. His main aim is to educate his children. His business goal is to buy land to grow crops so as to spread risks. George wants this loan to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a forty-five-year-old married man with eight children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a cattle trader and has worked at this for over three years. He started this business with seven hundred thousand shillings only, and now his business is worth three million shillings. James faces a problem of theft. His personal goal is educating his children, and his business goal is to buy land to grow crops, so as to diversify his income sources. James needs this loan to purchase cows for resale.

loans.use: to buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Chaeban Group

texts.en:
Majida, Fatima & Yousra are three neighbors, in fact, three best childhood friends who lived & grew up together in Nabatieh.

Majida is a 41-year-old married woman with three children. Four years ago she opened an ice cream & juice shop to help her husband with their living expenses. Today she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy new extra tables and chairs to increase the number of expected customers, as she is expanding the place so that it can fit more customers, in the coming spring season. This is her third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good paying-back history.

Fatima is a 44-year-old married woman, mother of four children, who works in agriculture, specialized in planting and harvesting tobacco for 18 years. She started this business in order to prove herself in the community and it was easy for her to take this step since her husband has his own land. It's only the early wake-up call in the morning that makes her feel tired, but the result at the end of each harvesting season makes her proud of herself. Fatima has also been an Al Majmoua borrower for three cycles, and all her previous loans were invested into her business with impressive results. This time Fatima is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary chemicals, plastic bags and nutrients for her agricultural business.

Yousra is a 44-year-old married woman, mother of two children. She has worked selling cosmetics and beauty creams for six years. Yousra started her business in order to hep her husband with their living expenses and to prove herself in the area she is living. She is a very sociable person with very good customer service. Her business needs her to be a very convincing person, and in fact she is. 

Yousra is Al Majmoua borrower, and her previous loans were invested in improving her business. Today, Yousra is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new spring & summer collection, highly requested  by her customers.

loans.use: To develop her business with necessary products and equipment

loans.name: Sejerina

texts.en:
Sejerina lives in Yei. She sells food and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old and has three children; two of them are in school.

Sejerina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 600 SDG in order to purchase cassava flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Rapid Women Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 57 years old, married with three children, living in Masindi, Uganda. He got money from repairing motor vehicles and now he deals in the sale of motor vehicle spare parts. His dream is to construct houses for rent and increase his family income. The fact that workers are unreliable hinders his business, and his dream is to expand his shop and also set up a modern garage.

Emmanuel wants a loan to buy motor vehicle spare parts for sell. He is a member of Rapid Women Group where members guarantee each other in order to access a loan. Initially the group was for women and later they agreed to include men but retain their name.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a 26-year-old married father of two children aged three and one, lives in Juba where he has been running a mixed-goods store for the past year-and-a-half. David, who heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officer’s market promotion, is requesting a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase more items including tea leaves, sugar, and rice.

David's major challenges include the high cost of living in Juba. In five years' time, he hopes to settle his family in their own home instead of renting, as they do now. He very much appreciates the support of Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as tea leaves, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for one year. She is 25 years old, and has one child in school. 

Victoria heard about BRAC South Sudan from credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Dezi

texts.en: Dezi  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 5 children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother and father). Dezi has a business of boxes of onions, tomatoes, oranges and cassava.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Dezi sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale. Dezi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She also generates additional income through selling piped water and a bar. The main business challenge(s) for Dezi include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing vegetables herself and to build rental houses.  Dezi lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, oranges and cassava

loans.name: Erasmo Alberto

texts.es: Erasmo Alberto 54 de edad, su negocio al que se dedica es la venta de recargas y además tiene una pequeña sastrería este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde sus clientes lo visitan. El tiene seis  hijo que cinco están casados y no viven con él, pero el menor  de sus hijos esta a su cargo todavía y lo apoyo en el negocio. Erasmo está solicitando financiamiento para comprar para ambos negocios telas, hilos, broches, y comprar recargas movistar y claro que son demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Erasmo Alberto, age 54, has a business selling rechargeable phone credits.  He also has a small tailoring business in his house, where his customers come to him.  

He has six children, and five of them are married.  None of them live with him.  However, the youngest is still under his care, and he supports him in the business.

Erasmo is requesting a loan for both businesses.  He will buy fabric, thread, and fasteners.  He will also buy Movistar rechargeable phone credits as these are in demand by his customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and fasteners.  He will also buy Movistar rechargeable phone credits as these are in demand by his customers.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, where she sells second-hand shoes at the market. Jalia has been in this business for the last five years and she works six days a week. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Jalia has no additional family members and she lives in her own house with electricity but no running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Jalia is requesting a 500,000 UGX loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. Her aspirations and goals are to buy a truck to transport her products and to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to sell

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a twenty three year old married man with one child living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a retail shop which he has operated for two years. He started his business with capital worth five hundred thousand shillings and now the business is worth one million shillings. He faces a problem of price fluctuation and inflation. His personal goal is building a permanent home and the business goal is expanding business into new markets. Justus needs this loan to buy sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar to sell.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 56 years old. He lives in village Chikaani, East Georgia with his wife Almat. Levan is a tinsmith. He has a small workshop, where he produces ovens. Ovens are sold in the villages of his district. Along with his main job, Levan is also involved in family agriculture. They have a small bee-keeping farm. Levan harvests honey twice each year and sells it in the local market. Also the family owns agricultural land, where maize and vine-trees are grown. Almat sells harvested products in the local market as well. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 GEL. 

Levan requested credit to cultivate the land with a tractor and to purchase melon seeds. After properly performing seasonal activities, the family hopes that they will receive a good harvest, which will be sold in the local market for a good price. The family will get additional income. They will be able to increase spending on their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and melon seeds

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for one year. She is 25 years old, and has two children, one is in school. 

Regina heard about BRAC South Sudan from credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 6 Group

texts.en:
Violeta is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor 6 (Faith and Love). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She said her most difficult challenge is to work in a foreign country. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoy attending church.

Monette is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around 5 years, starting with her savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying meat to be sell in her butcher shop. She will use the profits to save and reinvest to buy more quantity of products. 

This Esperanza associate is one of a group formed by Haitian citizens who live in the Bateyes area around Romana's sugarcane field. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area where the economy is dominated by sugarcane and upscale tourism. She thanks all of you for your support!!!.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken and pork

loans.name: Olga Francisca

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Agustín, ciudad conocida por gente trabajadora y sus mujeres hermosas.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Olga, tiene 61 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijas todas mayores de edad, dos de ellas aun viven con ella, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella ganarse el sustento diario y con esto ayudar a su esposos con los gastos que genera el hogar tiene un negocio de fabricación y venta de cojines, confecciona distintos diseños y modelos en las fundas de los cojines, luego los envía a Quininde y Quito lugares donde viven sus hermanas que se encargan de venderlos  en esos lugares, ella entrega a un bazar en la ciudad de Calceta y también confecciona bajo pedido. Ella lleva más de 20 años dedicada a esta labor y sus hijas le ayudan  cuando ellas pueden.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales para la fabricación de los cojines  como telas, hilos y plumón. Lleva 16 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que ha tenido del banco.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más  grande y más maquinas.
texts.en:
The members of the San Agustín communal bank get together every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta, known for its working people and beautiful women. 

Here we meet Olga.  She’s 61 years old, married, and has three adult daughters.  Two of them still live with her.   Her husband is a farmer.

In order to make a living and help her husband with the household expenses, she has a workshop where she makes throw pillows.  She makes different designs and styles of coverings for the pillows and then ships them to Quininde and Quito, where her sisters live and who sell them there.  She also delivers to a shop in Calceta and also makes custom orders.  She’s been doing this for more than 20 years and her daughters help when they can.

She will use the money from this loan to buy pillow-making supplies, such as fabrics, thread, and down.  She’s been with the communal bank for 16 years and she likes it because of the benefits she’s gotten from the bank.

Her dream is to have a larger workshop and more machines.

loans.use: to buy pillow-making supplies.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is 41 years old and married living in Hioma, Uganda. He is a farmer and he faces challenges of price fluctuations and inadequate capital. His family goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to diversify his business and start rearing cattle. Edward needs the loan facility to buy beans and groundnuts for planting.

loans.use: to buy beans and groundnuts for planting.

loans.name: Audesious

texts.en: Audesious is 38 years old and has six children. He lives in Hioma, Uganda. For ten years he has been farming. This has enabled him to educate his children. He faces challenges of price fluctuation and seasonal weather changes. His family goal is to educate his children. His business goal is to buy land to farm extensively. Audesious needs a loan to buy maize and beans for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for planting.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal is a 42-year-old married woman, mother of one child. Seven years ago, Feryal opened her own beauty salon in Nabatieh, to spread beauty all over her community as she believes. Most of her customers, neighbors and friends, and still they are the same targets but they increased in number especially that most of her neighbors started to tell their friend about her and thanks God business is improving.
To please her customers, Feryal applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to do necessary decoration to her salon, in addition to buying special beauty creams and cosmetics.
Feryal is Al Majmoua borrower for five cycles, which were invested in her business, with a good standing paying back history.
She is sure that her customers are looking forward for this change and she hopes it will reflect positively on her income and family.
Feryal is looking forward to open a special facial sector in the future, requested by most of her customers, hoping that the next loan will be for this purpose.

loans.use: To do necessary decorations for her salon

loans.name: Amudani

texts.en: Amudani is a forty year old married man having seven children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a bar that he has operated for one year. He started his business with capital worth one million shillings and now it's worth two million shillings. He faces a problem of the current irregular power supply and his dreams are educating his children and owning a hotel. Amudani needs the loan to buy a generator.

loans.use: to buy a generator.

loans.name: Dickens

texts.en: Dickens is 41 years old married with 4 children and he is a carpenter by profession and owns a carpentry shop. He started as an employee then saved his salary to start the carpentry business. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital and his family goal is to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his business to new markets. Dickens intends to use the loan to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.use: to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 32 years old and has three children. He lives with his family in Hioma, Uganda. William is a farmer who faces price fluctuations and seasonal weather variations. 

William is requesting a loan to buy maize to plant. His business goal is to buy land and grow more crops to diversify his business so that he can sell produce. His family goal is to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy maize to plant

loans.name: Rozhgar's Group

texts.en:
Rozhgar is a 27-year-old, hard working, and highly respected young Iraqi man. He is married and has one child.

Having started working at a young age, he already has eight years of work experience. His well-established garage offers such services as oil and tire changes. His garage has a good reputation and his services are very much in demand by car owners in the city.

Rozhgar took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq to be able to renovate his garage and improve his working conditions.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor, which makes them unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to renovate his garage and improve his working conditions.

loans.name: Reginah's Group

texts.en:
Reginah's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Reginah is 16 years old and lives in the town of kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Reginah has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Reginah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Reginah to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Reginah hopes that in the future she will be able to learn hair dressing. 

Reginah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Reginah's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale,

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 50 years old and does not have children. She lives in Yei. For the past two years, Sabina has been selling charcoal. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this will be her first BRAC loan.

Sabina is requesting a 600 SDG loan from BRAC to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from her loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is married with children living in Hioma, Uganda. For six years he has been farming despite challenges in price fluctuation and seasonal weather variations. His family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house. His business goals are to diversify his business and buy land to expand his farm. Geoffrey intends to use the loan to pay workers and also buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to pay workers and also buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda lives in yei. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three year. She is 40 years old and has five children, all of them are still in school. 
Roda heard about BRAC South Sudan from credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase maize andbeans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans for sale.

loans.name: Marius

texts.en: Marius is a hardworking father of 5 children living in Hioma, Uganda. He is a farmer and has been doing in practice for over 25 years. He has a challenge of price fluctuations. He hopes to educate his children and also hire employees to help him in his business. Marius intends to use the loan to pay workers who are clearing his land for farming.

loans.use: to pay workers who are clearing his land for farming.

loans.name: Kasara

texts.en:
Kasara lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 26 years old and has two children, not in school. 

Kasara heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man having 5 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. For 5 years, he has been in the transport sector and this has enabled him to provide basics to his family. In his business he faces a hardship of high fuel and transportation costs. His dream is to buy another car and diversify his business. John needs this loan to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires for the vehicle

loans.name: Restauration De Mon Repos Group

texts.fr:
Francisque est le coordinateur de son groupe Restauration de Mon Repos. il n´est marie pas mais il a 3 enfants.

Francisque habite dans la région de  Restauration d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité.

Francisque a dirigé son  commerce de charbon pendant les 7 dernières années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir  dans le commerce. Francisque espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son entreprise

Des autres membres  RESTAURATION ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon et produits alimentaires. Francisque dit que ses défis principal est d'agrandir son entreprise. Francisque dit que son but principal sont un homme d'affaires.
texts.en:
Francisque is the coordinator of the Restauration de Mon Repos group. He is not married but does have three children. He lives in the Restauration region of Haiti,where electricity is rare and water very limited.

Francisque has been managing his charcoal business for the past seven years. He would like to use this loan to invest in his business. He hopes that the loan will help him to expand his business. The other members of the Restauration group need a loan for businesses such as charcoal and groceries. Francisque says that his main challenge is to expand his business and his principal objective is to be a businessman.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 23-year-old married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a produce store where he has worked for over 4 years. He started with capital worth 1 million UGX, but now it's worth 3 million UGX. He faces challenges of price fluctuations and inflation. His desire is to educate his children, build a permanent home and buy land to grow crops. Julius needs this loan to buy beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy beans for resale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 37 years old married to Basantine and blessed with two children aged three years and nine months respectively. He offers electronic services, a business he started six years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

He has requested for a loan worth KES 40,000 to purchase electronic goods for sale.The profit he earns will help him repay his loan and add more stock to his business.

He dreams of having his own business premise and to educate his children to higher levels, this is his second loan.

loans.use: To purchase electronic goods for sale.

loans.name: Muzamil

texts.en: Muzamil is 24 years old and rears goats. He has been rearing goats for one year and he is very hard working which manifested in the fact that he started with one goat now he has twenty goats in one year of being in the business. He faces challenges of theft and high inflation. His family goal is to build a permanent house and buy a car. His business goal is to diversify his business by rearing cattle and expand his business to new areas. Muzamil needs the money to buy goats for sell.

loans.use: to buy goats for rearing.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old and married with eight children. He lives with his family in Kamwenge, Uganda. For the past eight  years, Peter has operated a retail shop. He began with capital worth 300,000 UGX and his business is currently worth 1,5000,000 UGX. Peter's major business challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.

Peter is requesting a loan to buy sugar and soap to sell. His business goal is to buy land to grow crops to diversify his income and his personal goal is to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona is 30 years old and has four children, two of whom are still in school. She lives in Yei. For the past four years, Lona has been selling fish. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this will be her second BRAC loan.

Lona is requesting a 1,000 SDG loan from BRAC to purchase fish. She will use the extra income from her loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Sauline

texts.en:
Sauline is 38 years old married to Edward who contributes to the family income. She supports five members of her  family. She has been running he salon for a period of about 10 years with a monthly income of 10,000 kenya shillings.

This is her fifth loan in KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones. She wants to use the loan to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to expand her business and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor 4 (Faith and Love). The group is located in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic and known for its tobacco and beef production. The group members are dedicated to selling clothes, food, shoes and jewelry.

Maria, who lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child, is dedicated to working hard and helping her partner to generate extra income to better their family living conditions. In business for approximately three years, she is excited to be taking her seventh loan from Esperanza International to buy fabric and other materials to produce children's, women's and men's underwear for sale.

Maria will reinvest her profits in her business and buy some furniture that her son needs. Maria thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric to produce underwear for sale.

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en:
Faridah's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Faridah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her rearing animals, from which she sells milk. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to build more rental houses, and will help Faridah to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to become a secretary. 

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Faridah's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to build more rental houses

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop that he started eleven years ago. He started with capital worth 1.5 million shillings and now it's worth 5 million shillings. 

In spite of his progress, Samuel is facing a problem of price fluctuation. His dream is to educate his children and diversify his business to include other general merchandise like millet flour. 

Samuel needs the loan to buy sodas for resale.

loans.use: to buy sodas for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, a 32-year-old businessman, lives in Juba where he is the married father of three children between the ages of six years and nine months, one of whom goes to school.

Victoria has been operating a mixed-food store for the past 10 months. Having heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officer’s market promotion, he is requesting a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase more items including sugar, rice, soap, and cooking oil. Within five years, Victoria hopes to build his own house, and he very much appreciates the efforts of Finance South Sudan in helping to uplift him from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more items including sugar, rice, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday lives in Yei. She runs a food stall, and has been in business for one year. She is 30 years old and has three children, all of whom are in school.

Sunday heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans.

loans.name: Angela Isabel

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Agustín, ciudad conocida por gente trabajadora y sus mujeres hermosas.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora  Ángela tiene 51 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación   tienen 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero dos de ellos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella tiene una tienda en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, leche, carnes y además también vende sabanas y productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), los mismos que también vende en su local aunque a veces cuando tiene tiempo sale a visitar a sus clientes cuando tiene que realizar los cobros ya que estos productos los deja a crédito, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00  hasta las 21h00, Tiene más de 7 años y le va muy bien cada dia aumentándolo con la ayuda de los créditos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos de primera necesidad, sabanas  y productos Avon. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 8 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a crecer un su negocio y su vida personal.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Calceta, the communal bank San Agustin meets every 15 days.  This is a city that is known for its hardworking people and beautiful women.

Here we meet Angela, 51, who is married and has 5 children.  Her children are now adults, but two of them still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

Angela has a store in her house where she sells all types of products, such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, vegetables, milk, and meat.  In addition, she sells bed sheets and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women).  She sells the Avon products in her store and, when she has time, she also goes out to visit her customers when she has to make collections, because she sells these products on credit.  She works every day from 6am until 9pm.  She has been doing this work for more than 7 years, and it is going very well; her business is expanding gradually with the help of these loans.

She will use this loan to buy basic consumer goods, bed sheets and Avon products.  She has been with her communal bank for 8 years, and she likes it because the loans have helped her to grow her business and improve her personal life.

Her goals are to continue to make progress with her business, and see her store continue to grow each day.

loans.use: to buy basic consumer products, bed sheets and Avon products

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARIPOSAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Silvia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de artesanía, tejido de mantas y mantillas, soldador y tienda de barrio, venta de deportivos, venta de dulces, venta de MP3 y MP4, venta de abarrotes, venta y reparación de celulares, venta de perfumes, venta de licores, tejido y venta de chompas.

La señora Silvia,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una familiar. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de venta de licores que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de licores) que adquirirá de los proveedores y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive con sus padres.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal association "Mariposas" (butterflies) will have its first loan cycle with the Santiago II branch of the microfinance institution Pro Mujer. The group consists of twelve members and is headed by a board under the presidency of Señora Silvia. The members of this communal association have businesses in the following sectors: sale of handicraft, weaving of blankets and towels, welder's workshop and store, sale of sports articles, sale of candies, sale of MP3 and MP4 players, sale of groceries, sale and repair of cell phones, sale of perfume, sale of liquor, knitting and sale of sweaters.

Silvia says that it is the first time she works with Pro Mujer and that she was invited by a relative to join the institution. Currently she has a liquor store, which she has been running for some time.

The loan that she now applies for will be used to increase her inventory (purchase of liquor) which she will buy from her suppliers and then sell in her vending place. This kind of work enables her to earn an income and support her family, because she lives with her parents.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy liquor.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is a 45-year-old married man with five children who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop where he has worked for 10 years. Denis started his business with capital worth 150,000 shillings and now it's worth 4 million shillings. His main challenges are fluctuating prices, inflation and customers who fail to pay bills on time. His dream is educating his children and expanding business into new markets. Denis needs this loan to buy sodas to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy sodas to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Sharifah

texts.en: Sharifah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has no children. She takes care of additional family members (old parents). Sharifah has a food venting business (restaurant). She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days a week. Sharifah sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Sharifah has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more, bunches of bananas, cassava, peas, sweet potatoes, beef and rice. The main business challenges for Sharifah include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant. Sharifah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and market dues.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, beef, peas, rice, sweet potatoes and cassava.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Yei. She sells food from a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is thirty years old, and has two children; all of them are still in school. 

Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 32 years old, married and lives in Hioma, Uganda. For the last two years, he has worked as a farmer and is proud of what his doing. His main challenge is fluctuating prices, which make it difficult to predict his profits and can result in a loss. He hopes to build a permanent house for his family and also venture into modern farming methods. James needs this loan to pay the workers who are cultivating his land.

loans.use: to pay workers who are cultivating his land.

loans.name: Poderosas De Comaravi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PODEROSAS DE CUMARAVI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lourdes. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de planta de zapatos, tienda de carnicería, venta de flores, venta de helado, venta de vestidos, cafetería, venta de chompas.

La señora Lourdes,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de plantas de calzados que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de plantas de calzados) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijas.

En la fotografía se encuentra el esposo de la señora Petronila, quien vino a acompañar a su esposa.
texts.en:
The “PODEROSAS DE CUMARAVI” Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional hub. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors chaired by Sra. Lourdes. The members engage in a variety of businesses such as: shoe sales, a meat market, flower sales, ice cream sales, clothing sales, a cafeteria and sweater sales.

Sra. Lourdes notes that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution on the invitation of a promoter. Currently she has a business selling footwear and has had it for some time.

The loan that she will take out is to increase her capital to buy footwear she will acquire from distributors and later market in her commercial space. This type of work enables her to generate resources to support her family. She is married and has five children.

In the photo, one of the member’s husband’s is shown. He came to accompany his wife.

loans.use: to purchase footwear.

loans.name: Clare's Group

texts.en:
Clare's group is comprised of four hard working women. Clare is twenty-one years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda.
